intro: Gardenia pterocalyx, commonly known as the African gardenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are often clustered in panicles and bloom during the wet season. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
